intro: Stenanthemum radiatum, commonly known as the radiant stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a globular inflorescence, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to the dry conditions of its natural habitat. Stenanthemum radiatum is often found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
